subject: Gardening
title: Vine Weevils and Container Gardens
description: One-minute skill: Vine Weevils and Container Gardens.

hook.text: Your potted plant collapses overnight. You pull it up and find the roots are goneâ€”eaten by white C-shaped grubs.

buildup.text: Vine weevil larvae live in soil and eat roots all winter. The adult beetles chew leaf notches but cause less damage.

discovery.text: Container plants are most vulnerable because larvae are trapped with roots. In open ground, predators find and eat them.

twist.text: All vine weevils are female. They clone without mating, each laying 500+ eggsâ€”one can infest a greenhouse.

climax.text: Biological control with nematode drenches is the most effective and ecological solution for container vine weevils.

punchline.text: Vine weevils are all female, all fertile, all trouble.

quiz.question: Why are container plants especially vulnerable to vine weevil damage?
options: Containers retain more moisture which weevils prefer
Larvae are trapped with roots in containers, without natural predators to control them
Container soil lacks the bacteria that normally kill weevil eggs
